page.title: 02Tourism
page.content: Morecambe began to grow as a holiday resort in the mid 19th century and reached its peak in the 1950's. Its popularity has waned since then because of the growth in foreign package holidays. Despite this it still offers much and is particularly popular with Scottish visitors. In addition to the usual seaside attractions it has many unique {attractions. One is the multi million {pound Leisure Centre. Others include {the sunsets and spectacular views {across the Bay to the Lakeland Hills. The season is short but in an attempt {to extend it the illuminations go on in mid-August until early October. The carnival is staged early season and a {Folklore Festival in August. Unfortunately if the weather is wet then there is very little indoor entertainment.
